Updated November     pm



Similarly to many UW departments across campus ASUW faces its own budget concerns PERIOD

According to a statement released yesterday by ASUW the association currently faces a projected budget deficit of  for the  school year PERIOD Members of the ASUW Board of Directors came to the Student Senate meeting last night to discuss the situation and Neil Rotta ASUW Finance and Budget director offered explanations on the issue PERIOD

 Rotta said PERIOD

According to the statement 

ASUW president Madeleine McKenna said at the meeting that it was important to bring this process to the students in the Senate and get feedback because most of the budget for ASUW comes from the students PERIOD

 McKenna said PERIOD 

Currently ASUWs budget goes to fund ASUW administration Student Senate commissions programs and services and enterprises PERIOD The enterprises include the ASUW Bike Shop and the Experimental College PERIOD

ASUW receives funds from the Services and Activities Fee SAF which its committee allocates  annually to ASUW PERIOD Students currently pay a  fee each year which goes to SAF PERIOD ASUW also collects about  in revenue from the Experimental College registration and course fees Bike Shop and Arts and Entertainment tickets PERIOD With the allocation and revenue combined the associations budget adds up to a  PERIOD Total expenses for ASUW are  which results in a  annual deficit PERIOD

The deficit is paid for by ASUWs general fund which Rotta said fluctuates annually and estimates contains roughly  dollars PERIOD

Rotta said that the ASUW Bike Shop and the Experimental College are meant to make money but they sometimes result in costing the association money PERIOD He said the Experimental College is one of the main contributors to the deficit PERIOD Rotta said the reason that the Experimental College contributes to the deficit is that it is not covered by SAF so the money to run the college comes from the revenue ASUW receives from its internal sources PERIOD However Rotta said that after undergoing expense cuts the Experimental College is now running more efficiently PERIOD

 Rotta said PERIOD 

The budget issues are causing ASUW to look at adjusting its largest expenses including employee wages PERIOD ASUW currently has  paid positions and Rotta said the majority of employees are compensated by salary and not by hourly wages PERIOD He said wages comprise about  percent of ASUWs costs PERIOD

 Rotta said PERIOD 

Rotta wouldnt go into detail but said that wage cuts are on the table 

McKenna spoke to the Senate about the importance of making strategic adjustments in the budget and that since last summer the ASUW Board of Directors has been looking into both longterm and shortterm planning for 

 McKenna said PERIOD 

One of the steps ASUW is taking is the creation of a committee to focus on obtaining donations from alumni to secure another funding source PERIOD

 Rotta said PERIOD

Rotta said that he thought this was the first time a budget forum was held with the Student Senate and that it went well PERIOD

 Rotta said PERIOD

Aside from looking into alternative funding sources no other specifics were revealed about upcoming plans to address the budget PERIOD

Reach reporter Sarah Schweppe at newsdailyuw.com PERIOD
